article_title: Fed’s Policy-Setters Likely to Be More United
article_text:
The Federal Reserve’s top policy-making body is likely to appear more united in 2015 than in 2014, even though the central bank’s internal debate is heating up over when to raise interest rates.

The rate-setting Federal Open Market Committee recorded at least one dissent at five of its eight meetings last year, culminating with a high of three nay votes in December.

All the dissents were cast by three officials, none of whom...

twitter.description: The Federal Reserve’s top policy-making body is likely to appear more united in 2015 than in 2014 as three dissenting voices lose their votes, even though the central bank’s internal debate is heating up over when to raise interest rates.
